oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Maps of Lakeland - plan B exercise
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two maps illustrating the so-called Lakeland Plan or Plan B, which was an internal security plan of the Second Infantry Brigade of the Tennessee State Guard during World War II.

Accompanying these maps is a typed note signed by Brig. Gen. Jacob McGavock Dickinson stating that this plan was carried out in training in Franklin, Tenn. by Second Brigade officers and enlisted men in May 1945 and was the basic plan of operations; employed during the six-day race riot period in Columbia, Tenn. in late February/early March 1946.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee State Guard, 1941-1947
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennesssee.Militia; Tennessee-History, Military; World War, 1939-1945
